channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024081443
item.description:
Report X-2024081443

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO THE IMPORT INSPECT AREA DUE TO A PACKAGE INSPECTION ON 18-AUGUST-2024. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (2) FLAMELESS RATION HEATERS CLASSIFIED AS 4.3 DANGEROUS WHEN WET (UN2813), (2) BOOKS OF MATCHES AND (2) PLASTIC BAG WITH MATCHES (UN1944, MATCHES, SAFETY, 4.1, III) AND (2) BLISTER PACKS OF SAUSO KURO HEATING TABLETS (UN1328, HEXAMETHYLENETETRAMINE, 4.1, III). NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024081435
item.description:
Report X-2024081435

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE ORIGINALLY ARRIVED IN TO LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY UPS WORLDPORT OPERATIONS ON 11-MAY-2024 WHERE IT WAS STAGED FOR CLEARANCE FROM CUSTOMS. PACKAGE WAS RETAINED BY CUSTOMS UNTIL UPS WORLDPORT RESPONDED TO THE IMPORT INSPECT AREA DUE TO THE CUSTOMS AGENT DISCOVERY OF THE UNDECLARED PRODUCTS ON 18-AUGUST-24. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS, UPS DISCOVERED (20) FLAMELESS RATION HEATERS CLASSIFIED AS 4.3 DANGEROUS WHEN WET. NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 7V077R, GAIN COSMETIC CO LTD, RM 201, 9, YONGGOK-RO 20BEON-GIL, YANGJI-MYEON, YONGIN 17161 SOUTH KOREA.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found on flex slide by and admin with a wet spot from internal leakage and had a very strong chemical odor coming from it. Package was given to admin that processes hamzats and SDS was looked up, SDS states this product is a fully regulated hazmat with no limited quantity exemptions. No hazmat markings on outer package or label.

item.title: Report X-2024081079
item.description:
Report X-2024081079

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-10
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazardous material package containing four one-gallon jugs of hurricane heavy duty degreaser (UN3266) that had been placed in an undeclared overpack box that had no Hazardous material markings or identifiers since it had no markings, it went up the conveyor belt as a normal package causing unnecessary handling resulting in the degreaser to spill.

item.title: Report E-2024070637
item.description:
Report E-2024070637

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: RACELAND
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Tuesday, July 23, 2024, at 08:39 hours, a CSX Mechanical Manager reported an odor in the area of PROX 99823, a loaded tank car of Anhydrous Ammonia. The car was isolated and the shipper, PCS Sales, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-0723-00094). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and confirmed anon-accident release due to the B end liquid line valve partially open and secondary closure plug not properly installed. Contractor personnel closed the liquid line valve and resecured the valve’s closure plug. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Matt Painter (706-564-8118). At the request of the FRA, the car was held pending OTMA.

item.title: Report I-2024070093
item.description:
Report I-2024070093

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: SHEPHERDSVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LEWIS TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 34486
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver arrived at delivery site to pump product into the above ground tank. When the tank filled to capacity the 90% shut off didn't work and allowed product to overfill into diked area. Driver immediately called dispatch office, dispatch called headquarters and spoke to Julie Jennings who then called Perdue Environmental Contracting Company, Inc. for Emergency Response and Clean-up. Call was placed to NRC and KYEPA to report the spill and clean-up efforts.
